comments.commentBody: I disagree. Rubio is a very acceptable candidate, and far preferable to Hillary Clinton. Her economic ideas are a disaster.

comments.userDisplayName: Divorce is Good For American Economy
comments.commentBody:
Bingo.

"Read my lips" as also not-that-much Pres. Bush One said.
He hasn't demonstrated any of that yet.

Trump may be running as a populist, but he is telling it like it is. Trump is not politically correct, like every other establishment politician. Trump will surprise every one in the election by demonstrating that he is smart, moderate, and capable to be president

Jeb never really understood how workers whose jobs have been exported could be so angry, or how a nation founded upon the rule of law could be so upset with 11 million people who violated those laws by entering the country illegally.

Donald Trump may be crass, but he gets it.
Trump was for the war and now lies about it incessantly.

Thank God. Bush is out. We do not need another Bush in DC. One
of them caused untold misery on many innocent people, Iraq War.
I just may have to go for someone new this time.
Sitting ducks when Trump is aiming are dead ducks!

After Rubio and Cruz were so arrogant and disrespectful towards President Obama, denying his authority to nominate Scalia's replacement, it's vindicating to see them take a drubbing (I know, Trump said the same thing, but those two are sitting Senators).
*packages of dried chorizo, not pages.
Would you be so thankful if he did the same to the Clinton political dynasty?

Considering what a Television circus this has been, Jeb Bush was probably the sanest of the bunch for bailing out. I don't like Republicans, but Jeb was far more diplomatic and in control compared to the rest. We might wind up regretting Jeb leaving the show.
So how do you feel about Obama's war.  Because at 7 years and counting, its his war as well.

Jeb's guilty conscience dampened any enthusiasm he may have had for running, after all it was he (and his henchwoman Katherine Harris) who clinched his brother's installation as president and the resultant wars and worldwide turmoil. One look at the photograph accompanying the article on his bowing-out shows how much Jeb has aged in these past few months.

Karma.
I have a PHD in Physics from M.I.T. and I support Trump. And you Sherr from NJ? Trump will win because he is quantum entangled with Ronald Reagan.

One is lazy and sloppy with his finances and relies on prefabricated long slogans instead of ideas and runs from any he associates himself with if he perceives a threat to his lazy cruise to the Presidency.  The other is Ted Cruz working very hard to overcome a basic aura of a less likeable and smarter version o the character Jon Lovitz played on SNL skits in the 80's I think.  "Yeah.. that's the ticket".  An Elmer Gantry who does become a smart lawyer and an amateur evangelist.  I lived in Dade County, Florida when the refugees from Castro's Cuba began their flight.  I later got to know other Cuban immigrants including a young woman who came to the U.S. after first leaving for Spain in the early seventies and beginning her college education here.  her father a physician by training an a dissident was in Cuba in prison.  My take on those refugees is that the U.S. the ones I have known personally make little issue of their status and don't use it for any purpose other than to remember it and their homeland.  The politically minded have been ill served with this 60 year period of limbo anti-Castro have put so many in.  Cruz and Rubio are nothing like my college Spanish language instructor who was a lawyer in Cuba and retrain to teach Spanish and Spanish Culture.  He was a kind inspiring man who imparted to a rural Appalachian 24 year old a love for the language and the culture as well as the people.  He didn't make a dent in my attitude toward opportunistic politicians.

You have perfectly described my experience today. Enough final answers were things I had never heard of and had no idea they were words that I just couldn't connect all the dots. DIKTATS? XIPHOID? FIXIEBIKE???? geesh.
But I did learn a good one that I will use and remember: INFOMANIA.

All this is to be expected on a Saturday, I am realizing.

To support Clinton is to support the candidate of the status quo of increasing the already hyperbolic inequality of income and wealth that makes the US a de facto plutocracy [vs true democracy where legislators legislate executives execute and justices judge with the aim to decrease inequality, esp. for the lowest quintile, which would benefit most]. Clinton, alas, is the candidate of the Democratic party establishment, which means that that establishment too stands firmly for letting inequality continue to increase, as do those in the academy and media like Paul Krugman who support Clinton over Sanders. Indeed, on the question of increasing inequality, the Clintonite Democratic Party is one with the Republican Part of W and Romney, differing only on the rate of increase. And is wasn't just a nightmare: we really did see Obama ready to give away the New Deal store if only the Republicans would sign on to a slight tax increase -- and then a tax increase so as to shrink the deficient, not to reduce inequality. How can any admirer of FDR Atlee and Scandinavia call him- or herself a Democrat today? How can one even vote for such a party? I will not be voting for Clinton; I will either not vote at all or vote for Trump who at least is against NAFTA and TPP type trade treaties, for reducing tensions with Russia, and for not getting into so many wars.

The idea that science and engineering graduates are less likely to embrace extremism would seem to be contradicted by the large number of terrorists with engineering backgrounds. There was actually a study conducted on this:

http://www.slate.com/articles/health_and_science/science/2009/12/buildab...
Good idea about using Za'atar! Kalustyans on Lexington Ave.has Za'tar as does the tiny  hole in the wall store, Nasser's on 28th St.(or is it 29th?) between 5th and Madison.
I think you mean Sahadi's (rather than Shades)

Speaking about Middle Eastern spices, Za'atar would be a good addition. Shades on Atlantic Avenue in Cobble Hill sells Jordanian Za'atar in their spice section, altos the Palestinian version (obtained from a coworker from Palestine) is superior. Good luck trying to find it.

Community colleges are where much of the vocational training is met here. It is extremely low cost and easy to get into. Depending upon what you want to do you can have a certification in as little as nine months.

It is a misconception that a college degree is "necessary" for a good job. I know of many, many people who didn't go to college who are now working for Fortune 500 companies, in positions from IT (tech support, coding, testing) to design to accounting. Let's not even forget that some of our most famous business leaders are college dropouts, Bill Gates, Steve Jobs, Mark Zuckerberg, Larry Ellison, Michael Dell, founders of Twitter...to name but a few. Famous investor Kirk Kekorian dropped out of school after 8th grade. The founders of Chick-Fil-A, Continental Oil and Petron Tequila never went to college, and these are just the famous billionaires. There are countless other successful business owners who never went to college.

I completely agree with your comment about vocational ed.  I teach at a secondary school with nearly all of my students living in poverty.  They want futures better than what they have now and work hard.  Some of them, however, have career goals that have nothing to do with college.  I have future plumbers, electricians and cosmetologists.  Keeping them in school when all they here is go to college is very difficult.  We need to start broadening opportunities for all students by adding a vocational track to a high school diploma that feeds into apprenticeship programs.

For those that say that college is not for everyone (which is true), what do you suggest be done for these young people? College degrees have become a requirement for jobs that realistically could be done without one. At this point, a college degree (or several) is a young person's best bet to avoid a life of crippling poverty. We have largely dismantled vocational programs here in America, we do not have strong apprenticeship programs (see Germany) and do not pay living wages for a large portion of the jobs that are available without college degrees. We need to strengthen the options for those that do not go to college, invest more in education at the K-12 level and provide living wages and a bigger social safety net.

We as a country have also decided to inflict millions with the yoke of debt for simply trying to better their lives and gain educations. Financial considerations are a large reason as to why students drop out. The college as a business model needs to be rethought because a more educated society is of value to all of us.

And the sound of wailing could be heard throughout the land as the Bush dynasty came to an abrupt and ignominious end (except for Jenna who's still filling in for Kathie Lee on the Today show...).  As he descended from the stage on which he had just delivered his heartfelt farewell to the troops- and to the dozens and dozens of supporters he had accumulated since he first announced his candidacy- Jeb! was heard to remark "If it wasn't for that jackass whose surname I share I'd be well on my way to coming in second in November."  All that's left for him is a hug from the Missus, an embarrassing trip to Kennebunkport and a letter of commiseration from Maureen Dowd who has now lost half of her material for 2016.
I meant ahead, not Shades! I hate spell checks!
Paraphrasing Yoda from "Star Wars:  Revenge of the Sith":  at an end the reign of the Bush family is, and not short enough it was.
You did a fantastic job of expressing yourself. I hope you get what you want  I look forward to more of your comments!

If either becomes President I wish they would do something to help elderly lifelong attention deficit disorder patient like me whose condition  is compounded by obsessive-compulsive disorder and dyslexia.  If they could only persuade the Times I should have an exception on commenters editing or deleting their posts I would probably have a better attitude toward Cruz and Rubio.  Forget it my OCD would have me doing it over and over and I would dislike them even more.

Yes, the office is sexist, just as the wider society is sexist, but to vote for someone simply because of gender, race, sexual preference, religion, ethnic group, etc. does not make sense.

What does make sense is to carefully evaluate the candidates, paying attention to not only what they are promising, but also to the probability that each would be able to deliver on all or some portion of those promises if elected. That is where Senator/Secretary Clinton is miles ahead of Senator Sanders and why she is the candidate who makes more sense, not to mention that she is an actual Democrat, while Senator Sanders is not.

Senator Sanders' responses to some of the questions at the last session hosted by Anderson Cooper seemed to indicate that he is only now fully realizing that, if elected, he will be expected to deliver on his very ambitious agenda or risk the scorn of many of his current supporters. He has already attempted to back away from some of those promises, explaining that he doesn't have a clear timetable for their fulfillment, since that will be achieved only with the cooperation of Congress.
Does anyone have the phone number for the guy who takes care of the dust bin of history?  I'd like to give him a heads up that the Bush family is on its way.

Some stupid people cannot even see the obvious, while some candidates who think people are stupid find out they are stupid and not the people. Times are changin, minds are changin and truth is either changin, coming out or being reparadigmed to be the ultimate truth...not the illusion.

3/4 of Republican primary voters in SC agree with Trump's absurd proposal to bar Muslims from coming to the US (http://tinyurl.com/zza9xo6). This isn't an issue of "differing opinions," as the GOP cheerleaders like to say, this is just people being rubes. People being lied to and amped up into a frenzy over scapegoats and fear. The wall will not be built. Muslims will not be banned. You will continue getting fleeced while people at the top laugh at you.

The GOP will win a few more local elections. Gerrymandering and voter restriction efforts will keep these hucksters in Congress around for awhile, but you can pretty much stick a fork in the GOP. It's not of the future. It's barely hanging on to the present.
one of th best shows ever on tv, i was mesmerized, waited eagerly  for it each week

Are we talking about South Carolina politics. Southern Conservatism, Evangelical extremism, Republican Party Establishment, Racist speeches, Proposals with ambiguous plans and lobbyists money or Democratic Party Establishment...with its Southern Black superdelegates who have thrown their vote for a Converted Southerner who became a Converted New Yorker who became a Presenting-Progressive?

What are you talking about Ms.Georgia? Do you know your Southern history and politics...its nothing compared to where it was.
